intro: Cliffortia grandifolia var. denticulata, commonly known as the denticulate flaxflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Leguminosae family and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. It has a compact growth habit and is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly found in the wild.
